info.title: Trade Blotter
info.description:
The Trade Blotter API allows retrieving a list of trades available in MX.

* different sets of fields (`trade-views`) can be retrieved per trade. The set of fields are predefined per server-side configuration
* dynamically filter the list of trades retrieved
* subscribe to trade-views, to receive updates matching filtering criteria

The API can be used to serve named MX user use cases or Client Servicing use cases.

port.description: Port of the Public API Load Balancer (api-load-balancer service)

fqdn.description: Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) e.g. of a mock server or an API gateway routing to MX API load balancer

tags.name: MX User Trade Views
tags.description:
Retrieve list of trades matching filtering criteria.

Given a list of trades in MX, several sets of fields can be retrieved. This perspective on a list of trades is a `trade-view`.
The trades returned in a `trade-view` can be filtered on the fields available in the `trade-view`, or on additional trade properties independent from the `trade-view` definition.

tags.name: Client Trade Views
tags.description:
Retrieve list of trades matching filtering criteria, enforcing filtering by counterparty: to limit the risk of leaking client data in client servicing use cases, when interacting with the API through a "technical"/service account user.

Given a list of trades in MX, several sets of fields can be retrieved. This perspective on a list of trades is a `trade-view`.
The trades returned in a `trade-view` can be filtered on the fields available in the `trade-view`, or on additional trade properties independent from the `trade-view` definition.

get.description: Simple health check for the Prism mock server.

post.description: Return a static bearer token for Prism mock usage.

get.description: Retrieve the list of available `trade-views`, ordered alphabetically.

A `trade-view` returns a list of trades as a table, with a list of properties (`fields`). The available fields for a given `trade-view` are defined through server-side configuration.

Each `trade-view` can return a different set of fields. The definition of the returned fields (name, type) is part of the response.

**How to define the set of fields returned by a trade-view**:
  * Refer to MX official docs

parameters.name: internalDealPerspective
parameters.description:
"Internal Deals" are trades booked from portfolio to portfolio. They are represented as two identical rows except for the "Counterparty" and "Portfolio", which are inverted. Internal Deals can be identified by an "Internal" column.

`internalDealPerspective` allows returning a single row (a single perspective) for those internal deals:

* that of the initiator (INITIATOR). Those are the deals which are returned in the trade blotter screen without filtering.
* that of the beneficiary (BENEFICIARY). From the trade blotter screen in MX, this can be

It does not impact the visibility of non-internal deals.

If unset, the two perspective are returned (two almost identical rows per internal deal)

303.description: When the number of returned entries is lower than the total number of entries for this search Then a snapshot of the target set of data is taken And we are redirected to an endpoint allowing to browse this snapshot.

get.description:
When data from a view contains more than the maximum number of rows supported by the server, then a snapshot of the searched data is taken.

The dataset can be browse through this endpoint.

It is short lived: the snapshot will be purged after a certain Time To Live (TTL).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of results which will be returned.

410.description: Target snapshot does not exist anymore - its TTL likely expired.

get.description: Retrieve the list of available `trade-views`, ordered alphabetically.

A `trade-view` returns a list of trades as a table, with a list of properties (`fields`). The available fields for a given `trade-view` are defined through server-side configuration.
Each `trade-view` can return a different set of fields. The definition of the returned fields (name, type) is part of the response.

**How to define the set of fields returned by a trade-view**:
  * Refer to MX official docs

303.description: When the number of returned entries is lower than the total number of entries for this search Then a snapshot of the target set of data is taken And we are redirected to an endpoint allowing to browse this snapshot.

get.description:
When data from a view contains more than the maximum number of rows supported by the server, then a snapshot of the searched data is taken.

The dataset can be browse through this endpoint.

It is short lived: the snapshot will be purged after a certain Time To Live (TTL).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of results which will be returned.

410.description: The target snapshot does not exist anymore - its TTL likely expired.

post.description:
Get the description of a given view :
* `field`: containing all fields of the view (breakdowns and outputs)
* `primaryKey`: ids of the breakdowns in the view.

Hidden outputs and hidden breakdowns are not included in the details of the view.

internalDealPerspective.description:
"Internal Deals" are trades booked from portfolio to portfolio. They are represented as two identical rows except for the "Counterparty" and "Portfolio", which are inverted. Internal Deals can be identified by an "Internal" column.

`internalDealPerspective` allows returning a single row (a single perspective) for those internal deals:

* that of the initiator (INITIATOR). Those are the deals which are returned in the trade blotter screen without filtering.
* that of the beneficiary (BENEFICIARY). From the trade blotter screen in MX, this can be retrieved by filtering on the target portfolio (this is the only way to see this row in the trade blotter *MX screen*).

It does not impact the visibility of non-internal deals.

If unset, the two perspective are returned (two almost identical rows per internal deal)

insertedOrModifiedBySelf.description:
Only returns deals insert or modified by currently authenticated user.

`"insertedOrModifiedBySelf": true` is equivalent to `(GENERIC_VIEW.User OR GENERIC_VIEW.LastEventUser) == <current_user>`

303.description: When the number of returned entries is lower than the total number of entries for this search Then a snapshot of the target set of data is taken And we are redirected to an endpoint allowing to browse this snapshot.

post.description:
Get the description of a given view :
* `field`: containing all fields of the view (breakdowns and outputs)
* `primaryKey`: ids of the breakdowns in the view.

Hidden outputs and hidden breakdowns are not included in the details of the view.

counterparties.description:
Non-empty list of counterparts

* in case of `clients` perspective the developer is expected to perform externally the mapping
* in case of `sales` we expect a native way to declare the scope of visibility (authorization) and this will be leveraged seamlessly

303.description: When the number of returned entries is lower than the total number of entries for this search Then a snapshot of the target set of data is taken And we are redirected to an endpoint allowing to browse this snapshot.

BearerAuth.description:
MX API are secured with a bearer token following JWT.
For more information about how to obtain an access token check /authorize and /token of the [Auth API](https://developer.murex.com/apis/auth/documentation).

Errors.description: List of errors defined following https://jsonapi.org/format/1.1/#errors

errors.description:
An array of error objects, each representing a specific error that occurred during the request.
Each error object contains details about the error, including a code, title, detail, and status.

title.description:
A short, human-readable summary of the problem type (should not change from occurrence to occurrence of the
problem).

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem

status.description:
The HTTP status code generated by the origin server for this occurrence
of the problem.

viewCore.description: Core View schema, It contains the essential properties of a view, such as its ID, label, and description.

id.description: Unique identifier of the View, used to reference the view in API calls.

label.description: Label of the View - a short name to refer to a view

description.description: User friendly description of the View

viewDetailsExtension.description: A snapshot of a View, including metadata about the view, schema of the data, and the data itself (paginated).

staleDataTimestamp.description:
If set, indicates that the data is stale. It is guaranteed to represent the actual data state at the provided timestamp.

Data updates may or may not have occurred since this timestamp.

**Service maintenance is required for the data to be un-staled**; check the service documentation.

limit.description: The maximum number of rows supported by the server to return in one response

total.description: The actual total number of trades that the query can return. When the number of total is bigger than the number of limit, pagination will be triggered. The dataset can be browsed through the endpoint to browse snapshot.

schema.description: Schema describing the structure of the data in the snapshot

name.description: Name of the field, used to reference the field in filtering

type.description: type of the field, non-summable fields cannot be aggregated like date

primaryKey.description: List of fields that are used as primary key for the view

data.description: Array of data rows, each row is a dictionary of field name to value

paginationChunk.description: Metadata describing the current pagination of the result

offset.description: Number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set

limit.description: Limit of items returned in the current response

total.description: Total number of items available (without pagination)

viewSnapshot.description: A snapshot of a View, including metadata about the view, schema of the data, and the data itself (paginated).

id.description: Unique identifier of the View, used to reference the view in API calls.

label.description: Label of the View - a short name to refer to a view

description.description: User friendly description of the View

snapshotId.description: Id of the "snapshot" for this data query, for further browsing. The Time To Live (TTL) for a snapshot is by default 5 mins (configurable in trade blotter configuration)

schema.description: Schema describing the structure of the data in the snapshot

fields.description: List of fields in the View, including their metadata.

name.description: Name of the field, used to reference the field in filtering

type.description: type of the field, non-summable fields cannot be aggregated like date

primaryKey.description: List of fields that are used as primary key for the view

data.description: Array of data rows, each row is a dictionary of field name to value

dateOrToday.description: Date following the format YYYY-MM-DD or the constant TODAY

anyOf.description: TODAY is resolved as the current FO Desk Date of the User accessing the API. (according to the access token).

bookedOrAmendedDate.description:
* `bookedOrAmendedDate` filters on `(GENERIC_VIEW.TradeDate OR GENERIC_VIEW.LastEventDate)`. The same filters as for the `columnValues` are available
* to support a date range, have 2 elements in the array, with “le/lt/ge/gt” as operator, instead of “in”
* there is no consistency check: all criteria from the array are applied even if mutually excluding. If nothing is return, the search criteria need to be adjusted
* "in": ["a"] is equivalent to "eq": "a"
* examples of filter for various needs:
  * `{"bookedOrAmendedDate": [{"in": ["TODAY"]}]}`: filters out trade insertion as of past date so there cannot be past PL impact here.
  * `{ "bookedOrAmendedDate": [{"in": ["TODAY"]}], columnValues:[{"field": "EffectiveTradeDate", "eq": "TODAY"}]}` to exclude late trading ( late trading date = Today +1OD)
  * `{ "bookedOrAmendedDate": [{"in": ["2021-10-10"]}], columnValues:[{"field": "EffectiveTradeDate", "eq": "TODAY"}]}` to spot past corrections that contribute to the PL only today
  * `{"columnValues":[{"field": "InsertionDate", "eq": "TODAY"}]}` to return all trades technically inserted today (regardless of the trade date and effective trade date), even those who may impact past PL.
  * `{"columnValues":[{"field": "InsertionDate", "eq": "TODAY"}, {"field": "EffectiveTradeDate", "eq": "TODAY"}]}` to return all trades technically inserted today (regardless of the trade date and effective trade date), excluding those impacting past PL.

operatorArray.description: Values matching the operator, applies for array filters (in, not in)

items.description: Values matching the operator, applies for array filters

operator.description: Value for matching the operator, applies for single value filters (eq, neq, le, lt, ge, gt)

columnValues.description:
List of filtering criteria per column:
 * several filters can be applied on the same column
 * the API looks for the results where all criteria match (intersection / AND clause)
 * if a field from the view is of type "date", then `TODAY` can be used as a valid value ; api interprets it as the logged in users FO Desk Date
 * for "in", "nin", the elements of operator array can accept null only for date field 
 * for "eq", "neq", the operator can accept null only for date field
 * for "le", "lt", "ge", "gt", the operator cannot accept null

field.description: Label of the parameter to filter on. The parameter must exist in the `filter` referenced by the `filterId`.

403-Forbidden.description: Forbidden - User does not have permission to perform this action.

unauthorized.summary: Forbidden - User does not have permission to perform this action.

errors.title: Forbidden
errors.detail: User does not have permission to perform this action.

404-NotFound.description:
Target URL or object does not exist.
This status may also be returned if the user does not have the permissions to access the target resource, to prevent discovering whether a given resource exists or not.

notFound.summary: Target URL or object does not exist.

errors.title: Target URL or object does not exist.
errors.detail: Target URL or object does not exist.

View.description:
Details on the selected view - restricted to the description of the columns (order, name, type)
retrieved through this view, and the "primary keys" allowing uniquely identifying a row (**note**:
some primary keys might be hidden on screen).

value.label: Daily Basic

trade-view-search.description:
A complex search request:
  * deals in portfolio MX_PTF1 or MX_PTF2
  * inserted or modified by current user
  * booked or amended exactly TODAY (FO Desk Date) or on 2022-12-12

client-trade-view-search.description: Client Trade View Advanced Request Sample

includeSchema.name: includeSchema
includeSchema.description: Set to false to only return the data, without the schema (column description)

tradeViewSpecificParams.name: tradeViewSpecificParams
tradeViewSpecificParams.description:
Each field from the `trade-view` can be filtered on, unless specified otherwise in the field description.

The name `tradeViewSpecificParams` is not part of the API contract, is it a logical name to group in the documentation those parameters whose name is configuration-dependent.


It is only possible to filter on fields available in the view.


* For each parameter, several values can be passed (each query parameter on a field name is an `array` of the field's type). The returned results contain entries having at least one of the values from the query parameter, e.g.:
  * `?counterparty=BANK A&counterparty=BANK B` returns all deals having counterparty `BANK A` **or** counterparty `BANK B`

* filtering on different parameters (e.g. status and counterparty) will return deals matching at least one value from each parameter, e.g.:
  * `?counterparty=BANK A&status=Ins` returns all deals having counterparty `BANK A` **and** status `Ins`
  * `?counterparty=BANK A&counterparty=BANK B&status=Ins` returns all deals having (counterparty `BANK A` or `BANK B`) **and** (status `Ins`)


Below are commonly used fields and the corresponding entry in MX blotter dictionary - where to find them when creating the view as a configurator.



|Field (final name is user defined)|Blotter dictionary entry under GENERIC_VIEW|Comment|
|-----|-----|-----|
| counterparties   | `Counterpart` ||
| portfolios       | `Portfolio`  ||
| status           | `InternalStatus`| ins, mod, cancl |
| inserter         | `User` ||
| Deal status      | `LiveStatus`   | Possible values: LIVE, MKT_OP, DEAD |
| insertiondate    | `SystemDate`|This field of type date (format iso8601) also access `TODAY` as a valid value. `TODAY` is a keyword resolved MX side as the FO Desk Date of the current user, deduced from the FO Desk or Group used at login time.|
| actualdate       | `EffectiveTradeDate` |This field of type date (format iso8601) also access `TODAY` as a valid value. `TODAY` is a keyword resolved MX side as the FO Desk Date of the current user, deduced from the FO Desk or Group used at login time.|
| modificationdate | `ModificationDateTime` |Time of the latest event on the deal. This field of type date (format iso8601) also access `TODAY` as a valid value. `TODAY` is a keyword resolved MX side as the FO Desk Date of the current user, deduced from the FO Desk or Group used at login time.|
| instrument       | `Instrument` ||
| typology         | `Typology` ||
| lastevent        | `LastEventClass` >> `Event Type` | Possible values: Amend, early take up, etc.|
| lastevendate     | `LastEventDate` | |

snapshotId.name: snapshotId
snapshotId.description:
Id of the snapshot for this data query.
If set, any filtering parameters are ignored

offset.name: offset
offset.description:
Used for pagination.
* results are sent by chunks of `limit` entries.
* if more than `limit` entries are available, then several requests will be needed to get all results.
* given default `limit` size of 1000, page 1, 2..n are obtained by having `offset` = 0, 1000, 2000, etc. (i.e. for each page, offset == (page number - 1) * `limit`)
* if offset > total number of results: 400 Error

counterparties_required.name: counterparties
counterparties_required.description:
Only retrieve trades whose counterparty is part of the input list. Possible values for the "counterparty" field are listed in the MX group chinese wall template.

Only views having a field name "counterparties" mapped to field `GENERIC_VIEW.Counterpart` from MX blotter dictionary can be used.

In case the `client-trade-views` endpoint is used with a view which does not contain the field properly mapped, an error will be thrown.
At configuration time, the availability of this field can be enforced.
